result.execSummary:
The defendant Angelina M Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $250 plus costs including the DNA and Drug Abuse surcharges.  To be paid during period of probation. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Joint & Severally liable for $250 buy money with co-defendant.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

All medications from the same pharmacy. 
Sign necessary releases for pharmacist and physician so agent can monitor medications she is on.
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if there are any.
Work within her physical ability and until such time she is declared disabled, or else to go to school part-time while she is working.

timeConds.notes:
Huber for employment and any counseling she may be involved in. 
Allowed to serve on Electronic Monitoring if approved by the RISK assessment and the jail administration. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Report to jail today for start date.  (8/21/15)

records.addlTxt: *Record Review*

Defendant Angelina M Scott in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:31 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court and both counsel have received the Record Review.  No corrections by either party. 
Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant. 

BY THE COURT: 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years: 
Pay fine of $250 plus costs including the DNA surcharge and Drug Abuse Surcharge. To be paid during period of probation. 
Joint and severally liable for $250 buy money with co-defendant.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if there are any.
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All medications from the same pharmacy.
Sign necessary releases for pharmacist and physician so agent can monitor medications she is on. 
Work within her physical ability and until such time she is declared disabled or else to go to school part-time while she is working. 
Serve 90 days jail. 
Huber for employment and any counseling she may be involved in. 
Allowed to serve on Electronic Monitoring if approved by the RISK assessment and the jail administration. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Report to jail today for start date.
Sentencing hearing at 08-21-2015 01:15 pm

Defendant Angelina M Scott in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:12 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant is quashed based on her voluntary appearance. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in. 
Court will order a Record Review instead. 
Record Review due by August 14th with copies to parties. 
Bond Continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Information filed.

0,000 sig bond:   Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs. Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia.    Submit to photographs and fingerprinting by the Portage County Sheriff Dept after court today.   Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  on days of Court.  Met with public defender today.
